text: J. L. Hemphill House, also known as the Lowe House or Woodie House, is a historic home located at Wilkesboro, Wilkes County, North Carolina. It was built in 1899, and is a two-story, Queen Anne style frame dwelling. It has a central hip-roofed block with slightly projecting gabled "wings" on all four sides. It features a 2 1/2-story polygonal corner tower with bell-cast roof and finial and one-story wraparound porch with sawnwork decoration. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1982. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Queen Anne architecture in North Carolina Category:Houses completed in 1899 Category:Houses in Wilkes County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Wilkes County, North Carolina
title: J. L. Hemphill House
